page.title: 04HOUSING, EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The area is quite sparsely populated with many inhabitants being full or part-time farmers or farm labourers. Housing consists of approx. 10 large farmhouses,numerous cottages and small bungalows. Within the past twenty years numerous rural 'family-homes' have also been built here and some are still under construction. Most people living in these houses and larger bungalows,who work, commute to Lisburn by car.There is one rural housing estate in the far N.W. Apart from agriculture,employment for some inhabitants is provided by quarries,fireplace builders concrete works and a few are employed by the D.O.E.Forked Bridge Water Filtration Plant.Here the water from the nearby Stoneyford Reservoir is purified before being pumped on to North Lisburn and West Belfast.
